column4: hi i am haveing trouble putting files on a usb flash drive. i cant seem to find the flash drive on my computer not under media and not on the side bar what should i do?
is it a new flash drive?
only been used oince
in linux?
no windows last
what is it formatted in? If it is ExFAT, linux won't see it
i used it on wondows once and now im trying to use it with linux
idk what the format is/.......if i reformat it wil;l i beable to open it on windows computers? and how would i reformat it?
vfat and ntfs can be shared between linux and windows. ExFAT is wondows only. Ext3/4 etc are linux only. Use disk utility.
ok how so i reformat it?
use disk utility or gparted. But you'll lose anything on the drive
i dont have access to a windows computer
ok
where is dick utility
i found it
IS THERE A WAY TO MAKE THE COIMPUTER USE SOME OF THE HARD DRIVE AS RAM SO MY COMPUTER IS FASTER?
caps lock sorry
do you mean using a flash drive as cache, like you can do in Windows?
no
just enything that can make my compuiter faster and i have tons of room left on  the hard drive so i figured why not
accessing the hard drive is one of the slowest things you can do. Swapping to the hd causes slowdowns
is there enything i can do?
if you have plenty of RAM you can cache frequently used programs on a ramdisk
but Linux is smart enough that that will make little difference
